intro: Campium tenuissimum, commonly known as the slender campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are linear and arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Campium tenuissimum is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with the right conditions.
